stem:
An 18-year-old female comes into the clinic complaining of diffuse pain in the right lower quadrant for 3 days. It began around her umbilicus which was associated with nausea. The pain aggravates with movement. She has a low-grade temperature of 99.6F. Her last menstrual period ended 3 days ago.

What is the most likely diagnosis?
disc:
Classic symptoms of acute appendicitis include right lower quadrant pain, nausea, vomiting, and anorexia. Usually, there is migrating pain from the periumbilical region. Atypical presentations include flatulence, indigestion, and generalized malaise.

The differential diagnoses include Crohn's disease, ruptured cyst, acute ileitis, tubo-ovarian abscess, and most importantly ectopic pregnancy.
